content:
The travel time from Naha to Onna or Yomitan by public transportation will vary depending on the specific location within Onna or Yomitan, as well as the type of transportation you use.

One option is to take a bus from Naha to Onna or Yomitan. The journey by bus typically takes about 40 to 60 minutes, depending on the traffic and the route you take. You can find bus schedules and information on the Okinawa Bus website (<http://okinawabus.com/en/>), or at a local tourist information center.

Another option is to take the Yui Rail, which is a monorail that connects Naha with the central and northern areas of Okinawa Island, including Onna and Yomitan. The journey by monorail takes about 30 to 50 minutes, depending on your destination and the number of stops along the way. You can find monorail schedules and information on the Okinawa City Monorail website (<https://okimoni.com/en/>).

Please note that the travel time by public transportation may be longer during rush hour, weekends, or holidays, due to increased traffic and higher passenger volumes. It's a good idea to check the latest schedules and information in advance and to plan your trips accordingly.
